page.title: 06HITCHIN PRIORY (2)
page.content: The{Radcliffe}family were to remain masters of the Priory until 1963. During their long reign a few of the Radcliffe line carried out the construction of a{mansion house}on the same site,most notably the Adam's Wing built by John Radcliffe between 1770 and 1777 at a cost of Â£27,000 but it was left to the last Radcliffe, Sir John,to restore the house to some measure of its former dignity and, beauty,which proved a massive task. In 1919 it was reported that the Priory had not a single bathroom in the house,very little sanitation,no electric light,no central heating and large areas of dry rot.In 1965 the Priory was purchased by Herts. County Council and after extensive repairs it was opened in October 1967 as a centre for educational courses.It has now become a home for an Insurance Co.
